text: David Rolfe Graeber (; February 12, 1961 â€“ September 2, 2020) was an American anthropologist, anarchist activist and author. He was known for his books Debt: The First 5000 Years (2011), The Utopia of Rules (2015) and Bullshit Jobs: A Theory (2018). He was a professor of anthropology at the London School of Economics. Graeber was born in New York City. He studied at the University of Chicago and at State University of New York at Purchase.
